lessons.title: The Global Landscape of Pediatric Health

Macronutrient timing for pre-competition loading, intra-workout hydration, and post-exercise muscle recovery.
Micronutrient demands of high-intensity training: Focus on Calcium, Vitamin D, and Iron for bone and blood health.
Hydration science for kids: Calculating sweat rates and electrolyte requirements without over-reliance on sugary sports drinks.
The ethics and safety of ergogenic aids (Creatine, Caffeine) in the pediatric and adolescent population.

lessons.title: Psychosocial Dynamics: Weight Stigma and Food Insecurity
outline: The impact of weight bias in clinical settings on a child's psychological health and future eating behaviors.
Addressing Food Insecurity: Practical strategies for the G.R.O.W. Method™ on a limited budget (SNAP/WIC integration).
The 'Division of Responsibility' (Ellyn Satter) in complex family dynamics and disordered eating prevention.
Cultural competence in pediatric coaching: Adapting nutritional recommendations to diverse heritage diets.
Building 'Body Neutrality' in the home environment: Coaching parents on language and food-neutrality.

lessons.title: Advanced Supplementation: Bioavailability and Safety Protocols
outline: Evaluating the manufacturing quality of pediatric supplements: Third-party testing (NSF, USP, Informed Choice).
Synergistic nutrients: Understanding the Vitamin D3/K2/Magnesium/Calcium relationship for skeletal optimization.
Omega-3 fatty acids: Optimizing EPA/DHA ratios for neuroprotection and inflammatory modulation.

lessons.title: Complex Failure to Thrive (FTT) & Growth Stagnation
outline: Applying the 'G' (Growth Assessment) to differentiate between organic and non-organic FTT in clinical presentations.
Advanced interpretation of velocity curves: Identifying subtle shifts in height-for-age vs. weight-for-height percentiles.
Clinical nutritional interventions: Calculating catch-up growth requirements (kcal/kg/day) and protein-to-energy ratios.
Case Study: A 24-month-old with persistent weight plateauing post-illness and the role of high-calorie density modulars.

lessons.title: Severe Selective Eating: From Picky Eating to ARFID

The role of sensory processing in food refusal: Analyzing texture, olfactory, and visual triggers through a clinical lens.
Systematic desensitization protocols: Moving beyond 'food play' to evidence-based food chaining and bridge-feeding.

lessons.title: Pediatric Metabolic Syndrome & Insulin Resistance

Case Study: a 9-year-old with Crohn’s disease in flare requiring a transition from liquid nutrition to a solid-food-based anti-inflammatory protocol.
Monitoring bone mineral density (BMD) risks associated with chronic corticosteroid use and malabsorption.

lessons.title: Neurodiversity & Nutrition: ADHD and ASD Protocols
outline: The Gut-Brain Axis in pediatrics: How microbiome diversity influences neurotransmitter precursors and behavior.

lessons.title: IgE-Mediated Food Allergies & FPIES Management

lessons.title: The Elite Youth Athlete: Preventing RED-S

The future of pediatric nutrition: Emerging trends, technology in coaching, and the evolving role of the practitioner.
Final Graduation: Understanding your certification benefits, badges, and the AccrediPro alumni community.
